The plant has a simple morphology with leaf-like structures that are usually arranged in two rows along the stem. Cyclosorus ceramicus is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and can often be found in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, called capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores for dispersal.
